intro: Euphrasia brownii var. collina, commonly known as the mountain eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the western United States. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and thrives in well-drained soil. It has hairy, glandular leaves that are often arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. Euphrasia brownii var. collina is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies for eye ailments.
